key_statement.description: Throats of disc corollas equal to or longer than lobes; pappi usually 0, rarely of 2 awns 0.1–0.3(–0.5) mm.
Cauline leaves ± scattered over proximal 3 / 4 + of plant heights, internodes mostly 45–95 mm
Cauline leaves ± crowded over proximal 1 / 4 – 1 / 2 of plant heights, internodes mostly 5–25+ mm or 1–5(–35) mm.
Leaf lobes mostly linear to filiform, 5–25(–45+) × 0.5(–1) mm; cypselae 2–3 mm
Leaf lobes mostly oblanceolate to linear, (5–)10–35(–45+) × (1–)2–3(–5) mm; cypselae 5–7 mm
Throats of disc corollas shorter than lobes; pappi usually of 2 awns or scales (0.5–)1–3 mm, rarely 0.
Perennials (sometimes flowering first year); calyculi of 3–5+, ovate to oblong bractlets 1–3 mm; ray florets 0, or 8, laminae 4–8(–12+) mm; cypselae (4–)5–8 mm.
Plants 10–30(–50) cm; ray florets usually 8, rarely 0; disc corollas red-brown
Plants (20–)30–80+ cm; ray florets 0; disc corollas yellow
Annuals (sometimes persisting); calyculi of 5–9, linear to narrowly triangular bractlets (2–)4–8+ mm; ray florets 8, laminae 10–20+ mm; cypselae 3.5–5.5+ mm.
Ray laminae proximally to wholly red-brown to purplish, or each with a proximal red-brown spot; disc corollas red-brown to purplish.
Calyculi of 5–6(–9), linear to narrowly triangular bractlets (margins hispido-ciliate); cypselae 3.5–4 mm
Calyculi of 6–7+, narrowly triangular bractlets (margins not ciliate); cypselae 5–5.5+ mm
Ray laminae yellow to golden (rarely proximally suffused with red-brown); disc corollas yellow or red-brown.
Plants 30–70(–120+) cm; cauline leaves ± scattered over proximal 9 / 10 of plant heights, internodes 35–100+ mm; disc corollas yellow, often with brown nerves
Plants 10–40(–70+) cm; cauline leaves crowded to ± scattered over proximal 1 / 2 – 3 / 4 + of plant heights, internodes mostly 10–35(–50+ mm); disc corollas red-brown or yellow with red-brown nerves
